metadata.description: Technology dependency tree with spread data
sources: Mokyr, Joel. The Lever of Riches (1990)
Diamond, Jared. Guns, Germs, and Steel (1997)
Needham, Joseph. Science and Civilisation in China

technologies.name: Fire Control
technologies.description: Controlled use of fire for warmth, protection, and cooking. Fundamental to human development.
technologies.impact: Enabled cooked food (more calories, smaller gut, larger brain), warmth in cold climates, protection from predators
sources: Wrangham, Richard. Catching Fire: How Cooking Made Us Human (2009)

technologies.name: Cooking
technologies.description: Heat treatment of food for safety and nutrition.
technologies.impact: Increased caloric availability, reduced disease, enabled larger brains
sources: Wrangham, Richard. Catching Fire (2009)

technologies.name: Stone Tools
technologies.description: Shaped stones for cutting, scraping, and pounding.
technologies.impact: Foundation of all tool-making, enabled hunting, food processing
sources: Schick, Kathy & Toth, Nicholas. Making Silent Stones Speak (1993)

technologies.name: Woodworking
technologies.description: Shaping wood into tools, weapons, and structures.
technologies.impact: Enabled spears, shelters, boats, and eventually complex construction
sources: Perlin, John. A Forest Journey (1989)

technologies.name: Agriculture
technologies.description: Deliberate cultivation of plants for food.
technologies.impact: Enabled permanent settlements, population growth, social hierarchy, civilization itself
sources: Diamond, Jared. Guns, Germs, and Steel (1997)
Bellwood, Peter. First Farmers (2005)

technologies.name: Animal Domestication
technologies.description: Breeding and keeping animals for food, labor, and materials.
technologies.impact: Provided meat, milk, wool, transportation, and labor power
sources: Clutton-Brock, Juliet. A Natural History of Domesticated Mammals (1999)

technologies.name: Pottery
technologies.description: Fired clay vessels for storage, cooking, and transport.
technologies.impact: Enabled food storage, brewing, water transport
sources: Rice, Prudence. Pottery Analysis (2015)

technologies.name: Copper Smelting
technologies.description: Extracting copper from ore using heat.
technologies.impact: First metal tools and weapons, beginning of metallurgy
sources: Roberts, Benjamin. Production and Consumption of Copper (2009)

technologies.name: Bronze Working
technologies.description: Alloying copper with tin to create harder bronze.
technologies.impact: Superior weapons and tools, drove long-distance tin trade
sources: Muhly, James. Copper and Tin (1973)

technologies.name: Wheel
technologies.description: Rotating disk for transport, pottery, and machinery.
technologies.impact: Revolutionized transport, trade, warfare, and manufacturing
sources: Bakker, Jan Albert. The TRB West Group (1979)
Anthony, David. The Horse, the Wheel, and Language (2007)

technologies.name: Writing
technologies.description: Symbolic representation of language.
technologies.impact: Enabled record-keeping, law, literature, accumulated knowledge across generations
sources: Robinson, Andrew. The Story of Writing (1995)

technologies.name: Iron Smelting
technologies.description: Extracting iron from ore at high temperatures.
technologies.impact: Cheaper, more abundant than bronze. Democratized metal tools.
sources: Wertime, Theodore. The Coming of the Age of Iron (1980)

technologies.name: Alphabet
technologies.description: Writing system where symbols represent sounds, not concepts.
technologies.impact: Dramatically simplified writing - learnable in weeks instead of years
sources: Sass, Benjamin. The Genesis of the Alphabet (1988)

technologies.name: Horse Riding
technologies.description: Using horses for transport and warfare.
technologies.impact: Revolutionized warfare, communication, and steppe empires
sources: Anthony, David. The Horse, the Wheel, and Language (2007)

technologies.name: Chariot
technologies.description: Light, fast, two-wheeled vehicle for warfare.
technologies.impact: Dominated Bronze Age warfare, enabled rapid conquest
sources: Drews, Robert. The Coming of the Greeks (1988)

technologies.name: Paper
technologies.description: Flexible writing surface made from plant fibers.
technologies.impact: Cheaper, more portable than bamboo/papyrus/parchment. Enabled bureaucracy and printing.
sources: Tsien, Tsuen-Hsuin. Paper and Printing (1985)

technologies.name: Magnetic Compass
technologies.description: Device using Earth's magnetic field to find direction.
technologies.impact: Enabled reliable navigation out of sight of land, opened ocean routes
sources: Needham, Joseph. Science and Civilisation in China, Vol. 4 (1962)

technologies.name: Gunpowder
technologies.description: Explosive mixture of saltpeter, sulfur, and charcoal.
technologies.impact: Ended age of castles and armored knights, revolutionized warfare
sources: Needham, Joseph. Science and Civilisation in China, Vol. 5 (1986)
Chase, Kenneth. Firearms: A Global History (2003)

technologies.name: Printing (Movable Type)
technologies.description: Reusable arranged type for mass reproduction of text.
technologies.impact: Books became 80% cheaper in 50 years. Enabled Reformation, Scientific Revolution.
sources: Eisenstein, Elizabeth. The Printing Revolution (1983)

technologies.name: Blast Furnace
technologies.description: High-temperature furnace for continuous iron production.
technologies.impact: Enabled cast iron, dramatically increased iron production
sources: Wagner, Donald. Iron and Steel in Ancient China (1993)

technologies.name: Steel (Crucible)
technologies.description: Iron alloyed with controlled carbon for hardness and flexibility.
technologies.impact: Superior swords (wootz, Damascus), later enabled industrial revolution
sources: Craddock, Paul. Early Metal Mining and Production (1995)

technologies.name: Lateen Sail
technologies.description: Triangular sail allowing sailing closer to the wind.
technologies.impact: Enabled ships to sail against prevailing winds, crucial for exploration
sources: Hourani, George. Arab Seafaring (1951)

technologies.name: Astrolabe
technologies.description: Instrument for measuring celestial positions.
technologies.impact: Enabled navigation by stars, determining latitude at sea
sources: Morrison, James. The Astrolabe (2007)

technologies.name: Telescope
technologies.description: Optical instrument for viewing distant objects.
technologies.impact: Proved heliocentric model, revealed moons of Jupiter, transformed astronomy
sources: Van Helden, Albert. The Invention of the Telescope (1977)

technologies.name: Steam Engine
technologies.description: Engine converting heat to mechanical work via steam pressure.
technologies.impact: Launched Industrial Revolution. Freed humanity from muscle power.
sources: Rolt, L.T.C. & Allen, J.S. The Steam Engine of Thomas Newcomen (1977)

technologies.name: Vaccination
technologies.description: Inducing immunity through weakened or dead pathogens.
technologies.impact: Smallpox eradicated. Billions of lives saved.
sources: Riedel, Stefan. Edward Jenner and the History of Smallpox and Vaccination (2005)

technologies.name: Electricity (Practical)
technologies.description: Harnessing and distributing electrical power.
technologies.impact: Second Industrial Revolution. Transformed every aspect of modern life.
sources: Hughes, Thomas. Networks of Power (1983)

technologies.name: Electric Telegraph
technologies.description: Near-instant long-distance communication via electrical signals.
technologies.impact: First time information traveled faster than physical transport. Transformed business, news, warfare.
sources: Standage, Tom. The Victorian Internet (1998)

technologies.name: Internal Combustion Engine
technologies.description: Engine burning fuel inside cylinders for power.
technologies.impact: Enabled automobiles and flight. Transformed transportation and warfare.
sources: Lyle Cummins, C. Internal Fire (1976)

technologies.name: Radio
technologies.description: Wireless transmission of information via electromagnetic waves.
technologies.impact: First broadcast medium. Transformed news, entertainment, warfare.
sources: Douglas, Susan. Inventing American Broadcasting (1987)

technologies.name: Antibiotics
technologies.description: Chemicals that kill bacteria without harming host.
technologies.impact: Made previously fatal infections curable. Enabled modern surgery.
sources: Gaynes, Robert. The Discovery of Penicillin (2017)

technologies.name: Transistor
technologies.description: Semiconductor device for switching/amplifying electronic signals.
technologies.impact: Foundation of all modern electronics. Enabled computer revolution.
sources: Riordan, Michael. Crystal Fire (1997)

technologies.name: Internet
technologies.description: Global network of interconnected computer networks.
technologies.impact: Most transformative communication technology since printing. Reshaped society.
sources: Abbate, Janet. Inventing the Internet (1999)
